availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Philip B. Hudson (Scott County, KY, hotel keeper)

body.p: Scott County, Kentucky, hotel keeper. Virginia native. Married to Laura Hudson. Father of Emeline Hudson, Cassandra Hudson, James Hudson, Irene Hudson, Irene Hudson, and Laura Hudson. Innkeeper in Scott County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Scott County in 1850. Hotel keeper in Scott County in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Scott County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 461B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 2, p. 18.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 989.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Scott County, District 1, p. 230B.
"Philip B. Hudson (1809-1881)," Find A Grave, Memorial 87024356, accessed October 24, 2023, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/87024356.
